name: Not Another Karaoke Night, Camden
description:
Struggling to find a fun karaoke night without paying extortionate amounts of wonga for a karaoke booth? Want to meet up with fellow karaoke lovers whilst dancing and singing your favourite nostalgic bangers into the night?

Then this group is for you!

Every Tuesday Not Another Karaoke Night hosts Karaoke Camden in the heart of Camden Market.

There is a long booth sofa right next to the dance floor where you can meet, mingle, get together and sing your favourite hits with. Whether it be rocking out as Freddy, duetting a magic carpet ride, or Spicing it up with Wannabe, we have it all! All we need now is your vocal involvement.

There will be a table for 6 people booked each night for Meetup members, however if you would like to invite more of your friends drop us a message and tell us whether you want to extend it for big party times.

If you have a birthday coming up and you can get 8 friends together you will receive a FREE bottle of bubbly for the table. Once again, drop us a message to book.

This is such a great night in such a great venue, with regulars and newbies alike, so we look forward to forming a fun community of singers whatever your level.

name: Gospeloke
description:
Ever wanted to sound like Tina/Stevie/Whitney on the mic? Have you always dreamt of singing on a stage, unleashing your hidden diva in front of adoring fans with a live GOSPEL choir backing you up?

Well GOSPELOKE; the capital‚Äôs 1st Gospel Style Karaoke knees-up, is for you.
Hosted by Shoreditch‚Äôs fallen angel, the ‚Äòludicrously entertaining‚Äô, Eleanor Conway, and from the makers of some of the capital‚Äôs best interactive producers, Jonny Unknown, you can expect one euphoric ceremonial singalong with soulful Toni Robinson and her 15 strong gospel choir backing you up all the way‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs a ‚Äòspirtual awakening with a pop concert feel‚Äô.

Think Sister Act meets your school assembly via Top of the Pops, with classics such as Madonna‚Äôs ‚ÄòLike A Prayer‚Äô, Blur‚Äôs ‚ÄòTender‚Äô, Bruno Mars‚Äô ‚ÄòUptown Funk‚Äô and Mary Mary‚Äôs ‚ÄòShackles‚Äô.
Of course that‚Äôs not all‚Ä¶ There‚Äôll also be anthemic, big sing-alongs, congregational harmonies and we‚Äôll be hearing your confessional tales along the way, awarding prizes for the night‚Äôs ‚ÄòBest Confessional‚Äô, ‚ÄòBest Solo Performance‚Äô, ‚ÄòBest Duet/Group Performance‚Äô and much, much more‚Ä¶

FB: www.facebook.com/gospeloke/

name: Red & Black Music
description:
Red & Black Music is a music management label comprising 4 projects - Di√°spora, Fiesta Latina, ÔªøPhasmaÔªø & Rory - all 4 of which started independently of one another and were brought together under the Red & Black Music banner covering 4 wide areas of music - Jazz, Latin, Soul & Brazilian.

DI√ÅSPORA (est. 2009)
Di√°spora
Large Latin/salsa band, Di√°spora lends itself to an expansive big band sound without losing the dynamism and spark of a small group, and combines sensuous vocals, sophisticated horn lines and explosive percussion solos. Available as a 5-12 piece.
Di√°spora Brasil
Di√°spora Brasil is the alter-ego of Di√°spora, a separate setup specialising in the myriad of styles emerging from Brazil; from Samba and Bossa Nova to MPB and Sertanejo, from Partido Alto to funk. Available as a 5-10 piece.

FIESTA LATINA (est. 2013)
Fiesta Latina
Small Latin/salsa band, Fiesta Latina is the smaller sister act and ‚Äúinstant coffee‚Äù alternative to the filtered coffee beans of its big brother Di√°spora, comprising piano, vocals, cajon and trumpet, creating an explosive spark of musical interplay, with an emphasis on live dynamic interaction. Available as a 1-4 piece.
Festa Brasileira
‚ÄãFesta Brasileira is a subset of Fiesta Latina, a separate setup specialising in the myriad of styles emerging from Brazil; from Samba and Bossa Nova to MPB and Sertanejo, from Partido Alto to funk. Available as a 1-4 piece.

PHASMA (est. 2017)
Phasma
The soul band. ‚ÄãA band delving deep into the Great American musical subconscious, Phasma brings out the best of soul, funk, rhythm and blues. Its lineup (lead vocals, backing vocals, piano, bass, drums, percussion, sax/flute and trumpet) lends itself to a slick, sophisticated sound coloured by the unique concept of soul that arose out of the African experience in America. Available as a 5-10 piece.

RORY (est. 2008)
Rory Jazz
The Jazz Quartet, formed in November 2008 whilst studying at the Royal Northern College of Music, draws upon a wide range of influences from swing and bebop to Afro-Cuban and Brazilian jazz to Motown, soul and funk, with a heavy emphasis on improvisation and live, dynamic interaction. Available as a 1-4 piece.
Rory Bossa Nova
The Bossa Nova Trio grew out of Rory's love of Bossa Nova and Brazilian music. Blending the warm, breezy tones of the strummed acoustic guitar and the crisp, bass notes of the cajon with saxophone, flute and vocals, the trio interpret a diverse range of repertoire by the likes of Tom Jobim, Ary Barroso, Baden Powell, Carlos Lyra, Chico Buarque, Durval Ferreira, Ivan Lins, Luis Bonfa, Marcos Valle, Roberto Menescal and Toquinho, and contemporary jazz-Bossa fusions such as Azymuth, Bossacucanova and Toninho Horta. Available as a 1-3 piece.
Rory Solo
Rory can be booked as a Solo Saxophonist (+ opt. flute, clarinet and vocals) performing with backing tracks. Offering a wide wealth of music spanning multiple genres that can be hand-picked according to the requirements of the event, Rory's extensive backing track repertoire is split down into set lists and play lists. Available as a 1-piece.

name: London Classical Choir
description:
JOIN THE LONDON CLASSICAL CHOIR! You will be made very welcome.

Before coming the first time email Matthew, subject heading LCC, at maestromattheww@yahoo.co.uk, and you will be sent pdfs of the music. For rehearsal dates, venue, payment (half-price for students, concessions available) and recordings see [londonclassicalchoir.com](https://www.londonclassicalchoir.com/).

Do you love singing **great classical music** **from all periods**, and enjoy interesting programmes such as *From Darkness to Light* and *Music from the Americas*? Would you like to **join a friendly, multicultural group** of about thirty people and **take your singing to the next level**? Would you like to take part in **regular concerts with the London Classical Orchestra** and perform in venues such as the V&A Museum and Trafalgar Square and to venues across the world via livestream? Are you interested in **solo opportunities**?

We meet two Fridays a month very near Chalk Farm tube and there are **no auditions**. Being able to read music helps, but if you pick up songs quickly by ear you are also welcome (we provide online practice tracks so you can practise at home). After rehearsals **enjoy a well-deserved drink** in a fine local pub. The choir was started in 2018 by the prize-winning conductor Matthew Watts, who will help you learn the music, improve your sight-singing and vocal technique.

If you are new to choral singing and enjoy music in all styles (pop, classical, world and gospel) then we recommend you try the [Primrose Hill Choir](http://www.primrosehillchoirs.com/primrose-hill-choir), and if you know any primary aged children who enjoy singing then there is the [Primrose Hill Children‚Äôs Choir](http://www.primrosehillchoirs.com/childrens-choir).

name: Pandoras wine bar
description:
This is a group dedicated to the appreciation of pre 2000 bands still touring today from the sixties right up to the late nineties.
The purpose of the group is to meet other music fans from back in the day. Attend live events and themed events.

name: Angie A's Keep Calm & Sing Group
description:
This group is for those who want to experience the power of singing and it's positive [health](https://keyword-assistant.com/s/?q=health) benefits. A vocal group with a holistic twist! A vocal group with an awareness of the power of the [BREATH](https://keyword-assistant.com/s/?q=BREATH) and an awareness of the THROAT CHAKRA. Breathing incorrectly makes conditions like migraines, asthma, low energy levels etc worse. The breathing techniques for singing can bring about positive [health](https://keyword-assistant.com/s/?q=health) benefits in just two weeks including relaxation.




If you join as a member, you are invited to attend a meetup within 4 weeks of becoming member. As this group will only have up to 50 members maximum, if there has'nt been any attendance [ either offline or online ] in the first 4 weeks of joining you will be removed to free up the space for those who want to attend and experience. You can always rejoin to attend a workshop.
To attend any workshop, a suggested donation of ¬£2 -¬£4 is made either prior to or after attending an offline or offline workshop. A Justgiving page link is sent to the participant after the workshop. Those who request it prior to a workshop will be sent the Justgiving link.
This workshop is led by professional vocalist/ Songwriter and Entertainer Angie A. Angela has a wealth of experience and skills to share; she performed backing vocals for established artists including for Olive who got to number 1 in the national charts with the song 'You're Not Alone' [ see Top of The Pops youtube clip ]. Angie is also an ex Britain's Got Talent contestant and has experience leading choirs '.¬†

Come and relax body, mind and soul and sing out! Have fun and experience the positive [health](https://keyword-assistant.com/s/?q=health) benefits! Workshops will be in North Finchley, twice a month, free to attend, for 1 hour, 7pm - 8pm at the Arts Depot¬†in North Finchley.
Here's a youtube clip for inspiration - [ we work on the beginning of this performance -
[https://youtu.be/1yUK0S_cEXY](https://youtu.be/1yUK0S_cEXY)
] plus the song ' Something Inside so Strong'.....Come and uplift your soul :-)

name: Sunday Assembly East End
description:
Sunday Assembly is a secular community that celebrates life... a global movement, now growing in the East End! We aim to help everyone live their lives as fully as possible... to Live Better, Help Often and Wonder More. We do this via regular congregations, where we share wisdom and stories, reflect on the joys and sorrows of life, and sing classic pop songs together with a live band, and then socialise in the cafe afterwards. Whats not to like?!

We aim to build up a community around these events where people support each other (e.g. via our Live Better peer support groups), as well as engaging with their local community and forming interest groups (e.g. book group, poetry, games group, or join our band...). We hope to provide a platform for people in this unique and diverse area to come together and discover what unites rather than what divides them. 

Find out more about the Sunday Assembly story here at https://www.sundayassembly.com/

Connect with us on facebook - https://www.facebook.com/SundayAssemblyEastEnd 

or on Twitter: https://twitter.com/SundayA_EastEnd

So come along to an assembly, a meeting or a social if you'd like to find out more. If you're someone who thinks about the deeper questions in life, likes to spend time with diverse and interesting people united by a common cause, and enjoys a good sing song (not compulsory but recommended!), then this is for you! You're also welcome to get involved in shaping this fun community.

name: Indiy - Music Industry Office Hours
description:
Welcome to this space to help aspiring and established musicians realise their full potential.

We will be holding weekly online events so join us from anywhere in the world!

We aim to help people in the music industry talk through their biggest challenges when it comes to getting stuff done.

This space is for anyone interested in the music industry but specifically helpful for:

\- Artists
\- Singers
\- Rappers
\- Songwriters
\- Mix Engineers
\- Mastering Engineers
\- Studio Owners

My name is Chris and I will be running this time. I am the founder of indiy.com a community of over 14k musicians and I have over 10 years of industry experience. So if you need any help, guidance or just want to get something off your chest, stop by and see if I can help!

To get an understanding of Indiy, our Purpose and Mission check out the following articles:

[40k Songs are uploaded to Spotify every day](https://indiy.com/how-many-songs-are-uploaded-on-spotify-daily/)
[The 10 Thousand Hour Rule](https://indiy.com/the-10000-hour-rule-becoming-a-master-musician/)
[Why done is better than perfect](https://indiy.com/why-done-is-better-than-perfect/)
[The Music Industry is not designed for you to understand](https://indiy.com/the-music-industry-is-not-designed-for-you-to-understand/)
[The 1000 True Fans Theory](https://indiy.com/the-1000-true-fans-theory-kickstart-your-music-career-now/)

Also for artists and producers, you can get some free stuff below

[Free Vocal Presets](https://indiy.com/job/Vocal_Presets/free-juice-wrld-style-vocal-presets-for-fl-studio/)

We look forward to seeing you at a future event!
